page.title: 08Communications
page.content: Communications were found to be minimal ...with both Deene and Deenethorpe possessing a small post-box mounted on a pole (two collections on weekdays & one on Saturdays). Deenethorpe also had a phone box, but at Deene only the concrete foundations remained. Residents explained that their kiosk was removed in recent years ...and despite a campaign for its retention, British Telecom demolished the box in the early hours of a morning ...with several inhabitants reporting that they were awaken by "the noise of the box being knocked down and taken away." There had been a sub-Post Office in Deene,but following the demolition of the original building, it moved into a terraced house, before lack of trade led to closure in 1974.
